data.text:
Animation design has long been one of the most incredible crafts among all creative professions. Nowadays, it’s a widely sought-after industry where professional animators are engaged in various projects, examples of which you can see in explainer video for cybersecurity industry software development to filmmaking, etc. Let’s revise the top 10 most excellent animators, famous cartoon artists of all time that made a considerable contribution to the industry via their famous animations and the way we accept motion design and animation in the present day.

What Do Animators Do?

Animators are real famous anime animators, creators of animated films, and artists, who create drawings with phases of movements of a cartoon or other character (layout drawings). They are also ultimate creators engaged in video design with motion graphics and other computer effects. They can help to Educate Users by Combining Animation, and teach you with help of commercial video explainers for luxury products, and other purposes.

What is a Professional Animator?

What is animator? Nowadays, a professional animator artist is responsible for creating a series of unique images, frames, to simulate movement. Their primary duties include creating visual storytelling in your video marketing, working with creative professionals, motion designers, animator names, developers, and voice actors to produce films, cartoons, video games, or graphics or other different examples of eCommerce product video marketing and forms of TV entertainment which proves the importance of animation in multimedia.

Best Animator Artists Ever

Going back to basics, we’ve compiled list of animators, the list of the most outstanding professionals from the realm of animation in history whose contributions remain timeless and the works – most influential.

1. Walt Disney

Walter Elias Disney was an American entrepreneur, famous cartoon artist, animator, actor, cartoonist, and film producer. He was a pioneer of the American animation industry and introduced several developments in the production of cartoons. His animation techniques are basic and applied by modern animators.

2. Robert Emerson Clampett

Robert Emerson Clampett Sr. was an American animator, director, producer, and puppeteer. Robert Clampett is best known for his work on Warner Bros. and on the television shows Time for Beany and Beany and Cecil.

3. Hayao Miyazaki

Hayao Miyazaki is a Japanese director, producer, screenwriter, writer, and manga artist who started his career as an animator and managed to produce stories worldwide known from Castle in the Sky to The Wind Rises.

Hayao Miyazaki is one of Japan’s modern-day greatest animation directors of best animation of all time. The entertaining plots, compelling characters, and breathtaking animation in his films earned him international renown from most critics, as well as public recognition within Japan. It’s hard to imagine the modern time industry without the immense contribution and influence of Miyazaki’s works.

4. Matt Groening

This is another big name in the industry due to The Simpsons and Futurama projects and famous character artists creations. Matthew Abram (Matt) Groening is another American cartoonist, producer, writer, animator, and actor best known for creating these hit television shows.

5. John Lasseter

Nowadays John Alan Lasseter is an American film director, producer, screenwriter, one of the famous computer animators, professional animator and voice actor, and the head of animation at Sky Dance Animation. John Lasseter was also known as an animator and film director who was the chief creative officer of Pixar Animation, the Walt Disney Animation Studios, and Disney Toon Studios.

6. Tim Burton

Not all of us may know that the actual profession of a worldwide known filmmaker is a professional animator or animation artist. He started as an animation apprentice. Today, Timothy Walter Burton is an American film director, producer, artist, writer, and animator of his amazing cartoons and so much more.

7. Matt Stone and Trey Parker

Both authors are equal creators & top animators of the animated series, which received five Emmys and was included in the rating of the best comedy shows according to Time magazine. Of course, it’s all about South Park. South Park is a caustic and cynical cartoon project, one of the main satirical motion design & animated series of our time created by not a professional animator, but two of such.

8. Stephen Hillenburg

Stephen McDannell Hillenburg is an American marine biologist, cartoonist, animator, director, producer, writer, and actor, best known for creating the Nickelodeon animated series SpongeBob SquarePants.

9. Rebecca Rea Sugar

Rebecca Ree Sugar is an American cartoonist, screenwriter, director, producer, composer, and songwriter. She is best known for creating the Cartoon Network series Steven Universe, which made her one of the famous animators, and the first woman to self-create a series for the network.

10. Joe Murray

Joseph David Murray is an American animator, writer, illustrator, producer, director, and actor, best known as the creator of the Nickelodeon animated series Rocko’s Modern Life and the Cartoon Network animated series Camp Lazlo.

Who is the Best Animator in the World?

Today, in the era of computerization, it is difficult to understand what exactly is the genius among famous animation artists, as there are multiple styles and techniques applied a variety of genres and technologies like the 3d explainer videos, and so on.

The animation specialists understand what level this work has. Only one sound for a ten-minute cartoon may be recorded for two months. So, the input of any type of animation artist may be huge enough to be called the greatest.

Nevertheless, who is the best animator in the world? Back in 2011, CNN admitted Hayao Miyazaki to be one of, if not the most influential anime artist and best animator in the world who created more than 22 masterpieces. Today, Hayao Miyazaki is still regarded by many as the world’s greatest living animator and an icon of Japanese popular culture with his animated films.

Back in 2002, his works burst onto international screens far beyond Japan with the ghostly animation feature of Spirited Away. At that time it smashed box office records in Japan, besides earning him an Oscar for Best Animated Feature.

Be it 2D explainer animation or 3D explainer videos, what’s most important, modern video production, including advertising, acquired a powerful basis thanks to the greatest animation design artists and their works once introduced to the public and imprinted into the industry history for ages. You can find great graphic designers, animators, and other teams of creative professionals who are extensively inspired by their creative work, still, learning and improving.
